trans-unit.source: Provides access to general information about a tablet pen.
Adds a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.GotStylusCapture"></xref> attached event.

The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that listens to this event.
The event handler to add.
Captures the stylus to the specified element.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%29> method to ensure that `element` receives stylus events even when the cursor goes out of the elements' bounds.

To release the stylus, call <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%2CSystem.Windows.Input.CaptureMode%29> with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode> set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode.None>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%29> method returns `false` if `element` is not visible or enabled.
The element to capture the stylus to.
`true` if the stylus is captured to element; otherwise, `false`.
Captures the stylus to the specified element.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%2CSystem.Windows.Input.CaptureMode%29> method to ensure that `element` receives stylus events even when the cursor goes out of the elements' bounds.

To release the stylus, call <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%2CSystem.Windows.Input.CaptureMode%29> with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode> set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode.None>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%2CSystem.Windows.Input.CaptureMode%29> method returns `false` if `element` is not visible or enabled.
The element to capture the stylus to.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode"></xref> values.
`true` if the stylus is captured to element; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the element to which the stylus is bound.
The <xref href="System.Windows.IInputElement"></xref> to which the stylus is bound.
Gets the stylus that represents the stylus currently in use.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice"></xref> that represents the stylus currently in use.
Gets the element that is directly beneath the stylus.
The <xref href="System.Windows.IInputElement"></xref> that is directly beneath the stylus.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsFlicksEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a flick, one of the possible system gestures, is a short, quick, straight stroke that can be mapped to a navigation or shortcut command.
By default, flicks are disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar>.
Flicks are enabled on all other controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether flicks are enabled.
`true` if the specified element has flicks enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether press and hold is enabled.
`true` if the specified element has press and hold enabled; otherwise, `false`;
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTapFeedbackEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a short animation occurs when the user taps the control.
By default, tap feedback is disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
It is enabled on all other controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether tap feedback enabled.
`true` if the specified element has tap feedback enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTouchFeedbackEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether touch input feedback enabled.
`true` if touch input feedback is enabled, otherwise `false`.

Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsFlicksEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a flick, one of the possible system gestures, is a short, quick, straight stroke that can be mapped to a navigation or shortcut command.
By default, flicks are disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar>.
Flicks are enabled on all other controls.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable flicks.
`true` to enable flicks; `false` to disable flicks.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
Press and hold maps to the right-click on a mouse.
In Windows Vista, you can disable this behavior on elements if you foresee a situation where the user might hold the tablet pen down without intending to simulate a right-click.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable press and hold.
`true` to enable press and hold; `false` to disable press and hold.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTapFeedbackEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a short animation occurs when the user taps the control.
By default, tap feedback is disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
It is enabled on all other controls.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable tap feedback.
`true` to enable tap feedback; `false` to disable tap feedback.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTouchFeedbackEnabled"></xref> attached property on the specified element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable tap feedback.
`true` to enable touch input feedback; `false` to disable touch input feedback.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusButtonDown"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusButtonUp"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusDown"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusEnter"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusInAirMove"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusInRange"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusLeave"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusMove"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusOutOfRange"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusSystemGesture"></xref> attached event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.Stylus.StylusUp"></xref> attached event.
Synchronizes the cursor and the user interface.
Applications may need to determine the element on which the cursor is located.
If the application uses animation, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.DirectlyOver%2A> method might return an element that has moved out from under the cursor.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Synchronize%2A> to be sure that <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.DirectlyOver%2A> returns the proper element.
